stimulusHtml:
Show all your work. Indicate clearly the methods you use, because you will be scored on the correctness of your methods as well as on the accuracy and completeness of your results and explanations.

 

The director of a bird exhibit at a local zoo conducted a study to investigate whether warmer exhibit temperatures increase the frequency of mating calls for finches (songbirds) during mating season. The director randomly selected 32 finches from the exhibit. The frequency of the mating calls, measured by counting the number of mating calls per minute, at the current exhibit temperature and again at a warmer temperature a day later were recorded for each of the 32 finches. All other variables were held constant between the two days. The dotplot shows the difference in the frequency of mating calls (current temperature minus warmer temperature).

(a) Explain what a positive difference indicates in the context of the study.

(b) Based only on the sample data in the dotplot, should the temperature of the exhibit be raised to increase the frequency of mating calls? Explain your reasoning in the context of the study. Do not perform an inferential procedure.

The owner of the zoo will only allow the warmer temperature for all of the finches if the director can provide convincing statistical evidence of a greater frequency of mating calls at the warmer temperature.

(c) State, in words, the hypotheses of the appropriate test the director should use to investigate whether the sample data provide convincing statistical evidence that the warmer temperature increases the frequency of mating calls.

(d) Assuming all conditions for the appropriate test are met, the director obtained a p-value of 0.387 for the test. Based on the p-value and α=0.05 would the owner of the zoo allow the warmer temperature? Justify your answer.

Consider a scenario in which 10 finches are randomly selected one at a time, with replacement, from the sample of 32 finches. Let the random variable F represent the number of finches out of the 10 selected with a negative difference in frequency of mating calls.

(e) Calculate and interpret the value of μF in the context of the scenario.
(f) Describe how the scenario could be modified to make F a geometric random variable.
